page.title: 15A Former Headmistress(cont)
page.content: In the early years children could stay at Broadwas until the age of 14 although some chose to go to the nearest Secondary School in Worcester. Later they went to the new Secondary School at Martley. Radio was used and later B/W television and tape recorders to help with the lessons. From 1941 to 1950 the school children brought sandwiches to eat at midday.In the 1950's school dinners were brought from a hut in Doddenham. Then in 1959 a kitchen was errected and school meals were cooked on the premises.
